chapter.title: Establishment
chapter.para: Real content needs to be inserted here.

listitem.para: Identification of broad catchment features and physical processes that dominate flood formation/modification in the catchment of interest (general topography, extent of floodplains, nature of drainage system, extent of modifications from natural catchment, etc)
How can different types of models represent these important features/processes (illustrated by specific examples, showing different forms of conceptualisation)?
Delineation between hydrograph estimation and hydrograph translation (i.e. collection and transport components of the system).
How do processes and their relative importance change with increasing flood magnitude, and how can this be dealt with in the model representation?

When is it necessary to divide catchments into sub-catchments with different runoff production/routing characteristics and to calibrate them with different parameter sets, to reflect significantly different flood generation characteristics?
Identification of where data (and form of data) is needed from the model and the impact of this on subcatchment and sub-reach delineation.
Identification of channel reaches (sub-reaches) and the data necessary for these sub-reaches.
Identifying significant natural or artificial storage areas and appropriate storage models

Identifying natural or artificial obstructions to flood flows which act to divert flows or modify natural flood behaviour and should be represented in the model (e.g. road and railway embankments, irrigation channels) and the data needs for suitable representation of these systems.
Modelling part-urban or urbanising catchments
Modelling urban catchments - could move to book 9 but needs cross referencing
Data needs for rainfall model, hydrograph estimation, and for hydrograph translation. Linkages back to section 7.2.2.2
Parameter values - link to 7.3.3 and 7.5 (distinguish between measured and inferred values)
General discussion
Highlight need to determine where and form of data needed from modelling system
Delineation between hydrologic model and hydraulic model
Topographic data (refer back to Book 1 Data Chapter)
Structure Data needs
Catchment features
Catchment data
Selection of subcatchment limits
Channel and floodplain data
1D â€“ 2D data and alternatives data
Determine locations
Data needs
Cross reference to following section for measured vs inferred parameters
Relationship of physical characteristics to values of measured parameters
